thread.title: Arsene Wenger responds to talk about his Arsenal future - 'It's in front of me every time I make a half-turn"
thread.title_full: Arsene Wenger responds to talk about his Arsenal future - 'It's in front of me every time I make a half-turn"

author: mirror
title: Arsene Wenger responds to talk about his Arsenal future - 'It's in front of me every time I make a half-turn"
text:
Get Arsenal FC updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Arsene Wenger admits he is constantly forced to confront his Arsenal future. 
Wenger’s current contract at the Emirates is set to run out at the end of this season - with another deal on the table. 
Following back-to-back defeats against Watford and Chelsea, fans have jumped on Wenger’s back to leave. 
Wenger has been in charge of the Gunners since 1996, but has failed to win a Premier League title for 13 years. 
The Frenchman said: “My future is in front of me every time I make a half-turn. Read More Arsene Wenger's future at the Emirates is in doubt (Photo: Matthew Lewis) 
“I dedicate my whole energy for Arsenal to do well. 
“I answer that every week, nothing has changed compared to last week, that’s basically it.” 
Arsenal are now 12 points shy of Antonio Conte's table topping Blues but Wenger has not given up on a fourth Premier League title. Read More
